item.title: Exporting your Google Stars to CSV or KML
item.description:
I‚Äôm part of the Google Local Guides and a question came up amongst our cohort about being able to export your Stars from Google maps into something useful you can then import elsewhere. For example being able to import by Name, longitude and latitude would allow you to import into Google My Maps.

You can visit Google Bookmarks and download an html file of your bookmarks, but it‚Äôs a relatively useless Netscape Bookmark format. So to convert this to a useful CSV file I‚Äôve devise this linux script using sed and awk:

CSV Export

for i in `sed -ne 's/.*\(http[^"]*\).*/\1/p' < GoogleBookmarks.html`; do curl -sL $i | awk '{split($0,a,"[")}; {split(a[21],b,","); printf b[2]}; {split(a[4],c,","); print ",",c[2],",",c[3]}' | sed 's/\"//g' | sed 's/\]//g' | awk '!/, , /' >> googbook.csv; done
This will output the Name, Longitude and Latitude to a CSV file.

To spit out the full address too use the following:

for i in `sed -ne 's/.*\(http[^"]*\).*/\1/p' < GoogleBookmarks.html`; do curl -sL $i | awk '{split($0,a,"[")}; {split(a[21],b,","); printf b[2]; printf "\",\""; printf b[3]; printf b[4]}; {split(a[4],c,","); print ",",c[2],",",c[3]}' | sed 's/\]//g' | awk '!/\",\", ,/' >> googbook.csv;; done;

KML Export

Visit http://gexport.somee.com/¬†upload your GoogleBookmarks.html file and then download the KML file (easy peasy).

item.title: Reinstalling TCP/IP Network Stack Windows 7
item.description:
Taken from¬†[https://pandapow.co/how-to/win-reset-adapter/] ‚Äì These instructions were used by a colleague recently when his network stack was b0rK3n. Running both the reset for tcp4 and tcp6 seemed to be key. Just resetting 4 did not resolve his issue.

Open the Command Prompt as an administrator

Run the commands in this document in a Command Prompt that has been started ‚Äú*as administrator*‚Äù.

  1. Click the *Start menu*
  2. Type *cmd* in the¬†search box,
  3. *right-click* the cmd item at the top and select *Run as administrator* from the menu

Reset Winsock

Resets Winsock Catalog to a clean state.
netsh winsock reset
*Restart computer*

Reset Firewall

This command restores the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security policy to the default policy.
netsh advfirewall reset

Reset BranchCache

Resets the BranchCache service. Flushes the local cache. Every configuration parameter of BranchCache will be reset to its default value.
netsh branchcache reset

Reset IPv4

Resets TCP/IP and related components to a clean state.
netsh int ip reset

Reset IPv6

Resets IPv6 configuration state.
netsh int ipv6 reset

item.title: Fixed: phpMyAdmin is throwing a #2002 cannot log in to the mysql server phpmyadmin
item.description:
This one had me going round the houses a bit until I the wrong permissions confirmed something to me.
Firstly the /etc/phpmyadmin/config.inc.php file is crud. For some reason this file doesn‚Äôt resemble the actual config file that you should use.
The file /usr/share/phpmyadmin/config.sample.inc.php is the format that you need for a correct phpMyAdmin configuration, so copy it to /etc/phpmyadmin/config.inc.php

Next you need to edit this config file. This isn‚Äôt the hardest of the things in the world to do if you just want the basics. You just need to edit the value for $cfg['Servers'][$i]['host']

Once you‚Äôve done that you can then login to phpMyAdmin using your mySQL credentials and get started.
It will bitch about not having the advanced features enabled. To do this follow the blog post I did at INSTALLING PHPMYADMIN ADVANCED FEATURES ON UBUNTU

Make sure you log out and back in to pick up the changes.

Enjoy,
Mike

item.title: FIXED: Ubuntu Not Seeing More Than 2TB of a Disk
item.description:
WARNING! Backup your data before proceeding!

For me this process didn‚Äôt destroy the data. I completely expected it to, but it didn‚Äôt. Make sure you backup in case you‚Äôre not as fortunate.

Move into Single Users Mode
sudo init 1

Unmount partition in question
sudo umount /mnt/disk1

Launch PartEd pointing at the disk in question
sudo parted /dev/sdb<br />
Make the Partition Table GPT
mklabel gpt<br />
Accept the warning and quit PartEd
Warning: The existing disk label on /dev/sdb will be destroyed and all data on this disk will be lost. Do you want to continue?<br /> Yes/No? yes<br /> (parted)<br /> quit

Check the disk (resize2fs required this before it would resize the partition)
sudo e2fsck -f /dev/sdb1

Resize the partition to fill the total available disk space
sudo resize2fs /dev/sdb1

Mount the disk again
sudo mount /mnt/disk1

And hey presto!

item.title: Landscapify ‚Äì Adjusting Portrait Photos for Landscape Frames
item.description:
I‚Äôve been making a lot more use of my digital photo frame since I moved into my flat but a fair few of the photos I want to make use of are portrait orientation whilst the majority are landscape.

For a load of photos I‚Äôve gone thru them and manually made them landscape by using a method I noticed that You‚Äôve Been Framed use when viewers send in mobile footage shot in the wrong orientation for tv. The technique is to enlarge a second copy of the image/video as a background layer to fit the width of the landscape orientation and blur the background.

I figured as I‚Äôd want to do this to a lot of images over time I‚Äôd make a script to do so. So using Photoshop‚Äôs Actions I‚Äôve done so and thought I‚Äôd share it:¬†Landscapify ‚Äì Mike Dixson.atn¬†Here‚Äôs how to load the actions into your Photoshop¬†http://www.imphotography.com/downloads/installactions.htm

Instructions

  1. Open Image
  2. In the Actions Window click on Landscapify
  3. Click the Play Icon >
  4. When prompted for the new canvas size enter the current width as the height and the current height as the width
  5. Click Ok (if prompted that clipping will occur click Ok to that too
  6. You‚Äôre done üôÇ

Hope it‚Äôs useful to you.

item.title: Can I Park On A Single Yellow Line?
item.description:
I learnt this today, & thought it best to share it with all to help you avoid getting a parking ticket or your car towed as was experienced by my friend today:

‚ÄúSingle yellows indicate a restriction that applies for any period less than 24 hours. A time plate is needed to show the times of control unless the restriction is in a CPZ and the hours of operation coincide with the CPZ operating times.‚Äù

-Taken from Tower Hamlet‚Äôs Parking Policy.

For instance, the road near me has resident parking Monday ‚Äì Friday 8:30am ‚Äì 5:30pm. Whilst this is very clearly marked on the side of the road with the restriction the other side has no signage at all, just a single yellow line.

Be aware of the above and hopefully we can stop this ridiculous psuedo tax on parking in London!

Share this with everyone you know please.

item.title: Lyrical Challenges ‚Äì Tips To Write Song Lyrics
item.description:
A friend asked me to write a piece on setting lyrical challenges for myself so I thought I‚Äôd post it here as well.

The Goal is to Have a Goal

First things first. When setting a lyric challenge having a goal is the key. If you‚Äôve got no reason to write a song you won‚Äôt get a word written down.
Often the reason is heartbreak or sitting there bored with your guitar in hand and happening upon something to explore. Setting a goal with a song challenge is a more proactive way of writing songs.

Once you have a goal you have something to work towards, whether it‚Äôs write one song by the end of the day, or write a song a day.

A Creative Goal

The next thing is to have a goal that inspires some interesting creative angles. It‚Äôs very easy to become stale in musical style and lyrical theme, something to put your outside your comfort zone, but also something to make you take different approaches to those you‚Äôd would normally take.

For instance, a title for a song normally doesn‚Äôt come to mind till you‚Äôve written a song. Start with a handful of titles, pick one and and explore what it could mean.
‚ÄúSee you on the¬†other side¬†of goodbye‚Äù ‚Äì Could be about the end of a relationship, or it could be about what happens after a relationship has ended and lovers want to remain friends. Or it could be about someone dying and the morning process.

Your Starter For 10

Ok so there‚Äôs a few suggestions for lyrical challenges to get your started

  • Title Ideas¬†http://www.lyricideas.com/¬†‚Äì Lists 10 potential song titles (and lyrics) per day
  • Write a Reply ‚Äì Find a favourite song and write a reply song
  • A novel idea ‚Äì Try and capture the main theme of a favourite character in a novel in a song
  • 5 Minute Rush ‚Äì A great way to quiet¬†your inner critic set a timer and write as much of a song as you can in 5 minutes.
  • Change Position ‚Äì If you‚Äôre songs are normally written in the first person, or normally from a narrator‚Äôs point of view then switch it up. Force yourself to use another perspective.
  • One a Day ‚Äì Similar to some bloggers, taking a 30 day challenge of a song. Write one song a day for 30 days. It doesn‚Äôt have to be a good song. But the act of writing every day will encourage your brain to generate more lyrics all the time and doing anything for 30 days in a row is a great way of starting to form a habit.

Take Advantage Of Your Little Thoughts

Whilst this doesn‚Äôt quite fit in as a challenge, I implore every lyricist to buy some of these soft pocket notebooks¬†and carrying one of these very pocketable pens¬†and take them absolutely everywhere with you! The times when I‚Äôve written the most lyrics are the times when I‚Äôm most idea and my brain has time to wander.

I might have a few minutes on a bus or a tube and my mind idly wanders through one thought or another, maybe driven by what I see in front of me, or maybe I‚Äôm lost in my own mind. But then BAM! I‚Äôm hit but a beautiful turn of phrase or way of perceiving something that I‚Äôd not thought of before.
If I can capture that right there and then I have a chance of working it into a song.
Otherwise it‚Äôs gone forever!

I‚Äôve tried to mimic this spontaneous note taking using my ever-present smart phone instead. However there‚Äôs something so unforgiving about typing text into a phone that means I lose the meaning almost as much as if I‚Äôd never written it down at all.

Good luck with your lyric writing!
